intro: Jacquemontia jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other flowering vines. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. Jacquemontia jamaicensis is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
